title: BBC Local Live: Norfolk on Wednesday, 11 May 2016 - BBC News
summary: pensioner says he 's been threatened with arson after stopping broadband engineers accessing a junction box on his land in yelverton .
a seven-year-old girl pulled unconscious from a leisure centre swimming pool died from drowning , a post-mortem examination finds .
it 's `` do or die '' for norwich city tonight who must beat watford to stand any chance of staying in the premier league .
almost 300 suspected or convicted criminals from norfolk are on the run having skipped court bail .
new lane may be built at a47 postwick hub to help ease congestion .

documents.title: our local live coverage through the day
text: that 's it from the norfolk team for today .
do n't forget bbc radio norfolk 's rob butler and chris goreham will be covering norwich city 's crucial relegation battle with all the usual match build-up and post-match discussions .
norfolk live will be back from 08:00 .
do n't forget you can send us your views on tonight 's game via email , twitter or facebook .

documents.title: police : it 's often difficult to track down fugitives
text: a senior officer at norfolk police says it is often difficult to track down criminals who go on the run .
his comments follow a bbc east investigation has revealed almost 300 warrants remain outstanding in norfolk .
those missing have been suspected or found guilty of offences including robbery , violence and sex offences .
we do have generally a small pool of warrants that are very difficult to execute because the people are out of the country or evading us . ''

documents.title: new pcc to outline plans for norfolk policing
text: the new police and crime commissioner for norfolk is to set out his plans for the next few years at a press conference on friday .
conservative candidate lorne green was elected last week and takes over from independent stephen bett .

he told the bbc : `` since saturday , i have been working hard to put my strategies in place to carry forward my programme and have been in close communication with the office and the chief constable . ''
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

tomorrow will be a mainly dry day with sunny spells .
feeling warm with temepratures reaching 19c ( 66f ) .
for more on the forecast where you live , visit bbc weather .

documents.title: a view on why norwich are in the long grass
text: is it a surprise to see norwich struggling at the wrong end of the table ?
probably not , but optimism was high back in august , especially with a bright , young manager .
what 's disappointing is that norwich 's fight for survival has rather petered out .
the main problem - they ca n't score .
the manager 's desperate to take it to the last game , but given norwich 's recent form and sunderland 's recent revival , it 's hard to see the relegation scrap going beyond tonight .
author: Tom Williams
BBC Look East sport

documents.title: two jailed for supermarket burglary
text: two men have been jailed for burglary at a norfolk supermarket where they stole cigarettes , dvds and packets of monster munch crisps .
joe walpole , 23. and joseph giddins , 25 , both from arbor view court , northampton , pleaded guilty to breaking into the harleston co-op in february .
norwich crown court heard giddins drove dangerously , the wrong way round roundabouts while walpole threw debris out of the window , causing a danger and damage to a police car following them .
giddins , was sentenced to 18 months in prison and banned from driving for 28 months , while walpole was jailed for two years .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: norfolk 's new pcc to miss first day at work
text: the new police and crime commissioner ( pcc ) for norfolk , conservative lorne green , is to miss his first day on the job to allow the previous incumbent to settle his affairs .
mr green beat labour 's dr chris jones by almost 10,000 votes in the election last week .

mr green , a canadian-born former diplomat who has lived in snettisham for three decades , said : `` i decided to allow the incumbent an extra day , thursday , to settle his affairs with the office and i will be in on friday . ''
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: king 's lynn college made football hub by fa
text: the college of west anglia in king 's lynn has been made an official football hub by the football association .
the aim is to train more students as referees and activators who can work with schools and amateur clubs to get more people playing the game - not just watching it .
this afternoon the college elite team are playing peterborough utd as part of a day of activities to launch the hub .
it 's the only one appointed by the fa in the eastern region .
author: Jill Bennett
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: sheet music library needs to be 'cost neutral ' says council
text: music groups across norfolk say they 're worried about the future of a library service that lends sheet music .
the service costs norfolk county council £ 10,000 to run and councillors say it needs to be `` cost neutral to make it sustainable '' .
music groups say the lending service is vital and have committed to raising funds to help cover costs for this year .
at the moment we 're raising relatively small amounts just to show good faith to norfolk county council that we are behind this scheme .
we are going to have find ways of getting substantial money by september . ''

documents.title: girl , 7 , found to have drowned in waveney river centre pool
text: a seven-year-old girl pulled unconscious from a leisure centre swimming pool died from drowning , a post-mortem examination has found .
the girl , who has not been named but is thought to be from lowestoft , was at a pool party at the waveney river centre in burgh st peter on 1 may .
she was taken to hospital but later died .
her death is not being treated as sus
norfolk coroner 's office said a date for an inquest was yet to be decided .

documents.title: sunderland points not a done deal says neil
text: norwich city manager alex neil says it 's not a foregone conclusion that sunderland will get three points tonight .
city 's hopes of premier league survival rely on everton beating the side from the north east , while also making sure the canaries manage three points against watford tonight .
neil says sunderland have their work cut out against everton :
they 're capable of beating anyone and i think their form has been better on the road than it has at home .
they 've got players that can change a game in the blink of an eye basically so we hope they can go and put on a good show . ''
author: Jay Lawrence
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: new lane may be built at a47 postwick hub to help ease congestion
text: an extra lane may be constructed to ease congestion at the controversial postwick hub to the east of norwich .
over the next two weeks norfolk county council is testing a plan to add a dedicated left lane for traffic .
it would allow people coming from the great yarmouth direction to thorpe st andrew to avoid navigating the roundabout and queuing over the old bridge .
there is space within the highway there .
i 'm not sure exactly what 'll be required in terms of hard engineering , but given that we 've spent well over £ 20m at this junction the cost will be relatively modest . ''

come on lads ! ! !

hundreds of wraps of suspected class a drugs , cash and 2 machetes seized after early morning raid in gy # tacunit

BBC Local Live

documents.title: mcnally 's timing unhelpful- balls
text: the back page of wedneday 's edp :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: watch : bbc investigation into criminals on-the-run
text: a bbc investigation has revealed thousands of fugitives who skipped bail while facing or having been convicted of criminal charges are on the run .
norman fowler , from colchester , went missing in 2014 after being sentenced to nine months in jail at norwich crown court .
he is one of more than 3,000 fugitives on the run from the east of england .
the bbc found fowler had been living under an alias on the costa blanca where he is being held in custody while on remand for unrelated gun licensing matters .
essex police confirmed an arrest warrant for him remains outstanding .

documents.title: bell ringing centre gets heritage funding
text: plans to set up a bell ringing centre at a church in the heart of norwich have moved forward .
those behind the st peter mancroft development say they 've been awarded more than £ 30,000 of lottery money .
it 'll be used to put together the plans to reinstate the church 's historic ringing gallery removed in the 1880 's and in doing so , create a ringing heritage and teaching centre .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your cromer pier
text: thanks to bbc weather watcher `` grinandtonic '' for the poster image at the top of our page today - featuring cromer pier looking moody in the clouds .
you can become a weather watcher too - take a look at their website for more details and we 'll look forward to seeing weather from your part of the county .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: the count-down is on all eyes on city
text: this is what the managers are saying about the crucial norwich v watford match tonight :
norwich manager alex neil : `` the odds are stacked against us , but if it comes down to one match then anything can happen .
we need to win
`` we need to keep believing and carry the fight .
we 're focused and still in with a chance , so we need to give ourselves a shot . ''

watford head coach quique sanchez flores : `` i do n't like to play against norwich and sunderland because they are fighting against relegation and it 's always very sad , but in this case we are the bad boy in the film .
this is our role and we need to play it . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: fans gear up for tonight 's crucial norwich city match
text: fans are cheering on the canaries as the team prepares to play for their premiership lives against watford tonight .
radio norfolk will have full commentary and pre-match build up of the norwich v watford game on air from 19:00 .
keep your tweets of support coming and we 'll feature more throughout the day .
# otbc
come on @ twitterid go out all guns blazing ! !
we need this win ! ! !
# ncfc # otbc # relegationbattle

documents.title: uea plans major increase to student numbers
text: the university of east anglia says it 's worth £ 0.5bn to the local economy .
that 's according to a report launched in norwich this morning - which also outlines uea 's ambitious £ 300m vision for the next 14 years .
prof david richardson , the vice chancellor , says its plans involve increasing student numbers by 20 % or 3,000 students over the next 10 years .
we can only do that growth in partnership , so we need to work closely with the local authorities , the people of norwich and the region more generally . ''
author: Clare Worden
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: former norfolk criminal found in spain
text: a serial conman wanted by police in norfolk and essex for a £ 21,000 fraud in the uk has been traced to a spanish jail .
norman fowler went missing in 2014 after being sentenced to nine months in jail at norwich crown court for stealing video camera equipment .
he 'd been living under an alias in the costa brava and is now in custody for unrelated gun licensing matters .
a bbc investigation has found almost 300 people in norfolk have gone on the run having skipped court bail .

documents.title: uea 's £ 300m vision for the future
text: the front page of today 's edp :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: boundary lines being contested in broadband row
text: norfolk county council , which is pushing for faster broadband in rural areas , says it 's speaking to a yelverton pensioner after he prevented engineers from upgrading a junction box in his garden .
the authority says it 's speaking with raymond moreton 's surveyor to establish who actually owns the land where the broadband junction box is located .

an upgrade would mean high speed broadband to more residents in the south norfolk village , but mr moreton says the upgraded , larger , box would `` detract from the price of my property by at least £ 50,000 . ''
he argues it could be located next to another junction box ( on a lane round the corner from his home .

documents.title: 'do or die ' for the canaries tonight
text: it really is 'do or die ' for norwich city tonight , who must beat watford at carrow road to stand any chance of staying in the premier league .
the canaries are also hoping everton do them a favour by winning at rivals sunderland , because if the black cats win then norwich are definitely down .
ahead of the big game manager alex neil has n't ruled out leaving the club at the end of the season if they do get relegated .

documents.title: investigation finds nearly 300 people in norfolk have skipped bail
text: a bbc investigation has found almost 300 suspected or convicted criminals from norfolk are on the run having skipped court bail .
among them is norman fowler who went missing in 2014 after being sentenced to nine months in jail at norwich crown court .
he was sentenced in his absence for stealing thousands of pounds of equipment from a norfolk cameraman .
he has been living under an alias in the costa brava .
he 's also just been arrested for unrelated gun licensing matters .

documents.title: pensioner threatened with arson in row over broadband upgrade
text: a pensioner in south norfolk says he 's been threatened with arson in an on-going row about access to a broadband junction box in his garden .
raymond moreton 's , from yelverton , has the village 's junction box on his property and has been refusing engineers access to his land to carry out an upgrade .
he says there 's already a new broadband box over the road and his garden is the wrong site for a bigger box as it would block the view of motorists .
norfolk police say it 's aware of the threats to mr moreton .
author: Janet Harnden
BBC Radio Norfolk

text: a humid and muggy start but some drier spells later .
